unnormalised: Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Inventory Forecasting Gets Predictive Boost
normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Inventory Forecasting Gets Predictive Boost

unnormalised: Mumbai, India - 28/07/2024 - Indian manufacturers are increasingly adopting advanced inventory forecasting techniques to optimize supply chains and reduce waste, industry experts revealed at the CII Supply Chain Summit today. The shift is driven by a need to navigate fluctuating demand, particularly in sectors like textiles around Diwali.
normalised: Mumbai, India - twenty eighth July two thousand and twenty four - Indian manufacturers are increasingly adopting advanced inventory forecasting techniques to optimize supply chains and reduce waste, industry experts revealed at the C I I Supply Chain Summit today. The shift is driven by a need to navigate fluctuating demand, particularly in sectors like textiles around Diwali.

unnormalised: According to a report presented by IIM Ahmedabad, companies employing machine learning-based forecasting saw a 15% reduction in inventory holding costs within the first six months. "Predictive models are proving invaluable in anticipating demand spikes, especially crucial during festivals and unexpected disruptions like the monsoon season," stated Dr. Sharma, lead author of the study.

unnormalised: Chennai-based textile manufacturer, Ram Textiles, reported a significant improvement in stock management since implementing a new AI-powered system on 01/01/2024. "We now anticipate needs with far greater accuracy," said Mr. Rajesh, Head of Operations. Concerns remain, however, regarding data security and the initial investment required for implementation.
